alert.note: Alert for Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 9:14PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Northumberland, northwestern Richmond and central Westmoreland Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 914 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Saint Clements Bay, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Coles Point around 920 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Lerty, Stratford Hall, Currioman Landing, Lottsburg, Westmoreland, Mount Holly, Sandy Point, Erica, Westmoreland State, and Templeman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for eastern and east central Virginia.
